items.title: Type Declaration
items.description:
Typescript is statically typed: Variables have a type assigned at compile time that does not change anymore.
For example: a variable of type boolean can only be assigned true or false.
items.exercise: var typeScriptIsGreat:boolean = 1; //TODO fix to make the program compile

items.title: Type Inference
items.description: The typescript compiler infers a type, if a value is assigned and no explicit type is declared.
items.exercise:
var typeScriptIsGreat = true;//same as var typeScriptIsGreat:boolean = true;
typeScriptIsGreat = 1;//TODO fix compile error
items.solution:
var typeScriptIsGreat = true;//same as var typeScriptIsGreat:boolean = true;
typeScriptIsGreat = true;
